intro: Cousinia campylaraphis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved cudweed, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia and parts of the Middle East. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Cousinia campylaraphis produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months.
